results.title: The Big muster
results.creator_credit: Ben Burgandy, Lex Halliday and A M P Society
results.brief_description: Shows the rural holdings of the Australian Mutual Provident Society, and its contribution to the cattle industry in Australia. This is a record of the contribution the A.M.P. Society and its policyholders are making to the Australian beef industry. Shows pasture improvement on established properties, development of new pastures and marketing.

results.title: The Big if
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Kamil Pixa, Peter Hollander, Kratky Film and United Nations
results.brief_description: An animated satire questioning what our money might be able to be used for if it was not spent on defence weapons. Animated by Boris Masnik.

results.title: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
results.brief_description: Looks at the development of the human brain from embryo stage through to the first years of life. Computer graphics, sonography and film of living nerve cells show the process and progress of development at different stages. This is a version of a French documentary, ‘Naissance du cerveau : dix milliards de galaxies’ with a dubbed American commentary.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Ayen Guinto, Charles Skoutariotis, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Katherine O'Neill, Krystal Webb, Laura O'Donnell, Maria Savarino, Marten McEachran, Paul Young, Samantha Sharp, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.

results.title: Dogs
results.creator_credit: Lex Van Os and FM-TV Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Talk to the animals”.
In response to thousands of requests, the producers of Seven Network’s “Talk to the animals” have compiled this videotape for dog lovers of all ages. Now you can enjoy your favourite dog stories from Australia’s most popular television series again and again. Hosted by Dr. Harry Cooper.

results.title: The Birders
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Winner of the 1976 Australian National Travel Association Jedda Award at the Australian Film Awards. The mutton bird industry of the Furneaux Islands (Cape Barren Island and Flinders Island) in Bass Strait is a little known and historic primary industry started by sealers more than 150 years ago. The film records the rugged life style of the small band of people involved in Mutton birding. Narrated by Ross Thompson and photographed by Kevin Anderson. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Morgan, John Richardson, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Kestrel Films (Australia)
